title: Question 15
prompt: <u>The teenagers littered the lake with soda cans. The teenagers played loud music at the lake.</u>
description: Read the underlined sentences.  Then choose the sentence that best combines those sentences into one.
feedback: The two sentences both start with “the teenagers”: “The teenagers littered the lake with soda cans. The teenagers played loud music at the lake.” To avoid redundancy, it’s best to use the subject only once and join the two predicates with the word “and.” The best answer choice is: “The teenagers played loud music and littered the lake with soda cans.” This choice also uses the word “lake” only once to avoid repeating it.
